instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad and no kayboard
threads.message: This board was tested with new trackpad and keyboard and they still dont work. Board problem. Any suspect?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad and no kayboard
threads.message: Power to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>? Other USB ports working?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad and no kayboard
threads.message:
Mouse light on USB
<CHIP>U5701</CHIP> VDD - 0V

<RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> - 0ohm pin1 -0V
pin2 - 1.7V

I removed <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> and I have
pin1 - 1.75V
pin2 - 0.11V

At <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> no short on both pins.
Diode mode

pin1 - 0.460 and 0L
pin2 - 0.452 and 1.450

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad and no kayboard
threads.message: Should be 3V at <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR>. Bad trace, run a wire.
